column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Seven Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Sunday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 422 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Sunday
column5: 642 on Saturday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.As of Friday
column7: the number of positive cases confirmed in the past seven days was 12
column10: 684 in the previous seven days. On Friday
column11: there were 326 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column12: up from 324 on Thursday.There were also 30 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column13: the same number as on Thursday. Last updated 5 December at 14:05 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3
column15: 393 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Saturday.Of those
column18: 981 of the jabs were first doses
column22: 942 were third doses.The remainder were booster jabs.Last updated 4 December at 14:10 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column25: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.Another 5
column26: 156 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Sunday.There are 503 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in the Republic of Ireland
column27: 110 of those are in intensive care units.Last updated 5 December at 19:15 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column29: 907 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Thursday.A total of 3
column31: 456 people have had their first dose and 3
column33: 959 have had their second dose.A total of 913
column34: 670 booster jabs have been administered.Last updated 5 December at 19:15 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
